title: Scripty Snail Font ID
content:
Here goes...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Picture_1_5221.png)
  
So this isn’t a font, just something I made. Anyone seen a font that looks like this?
 [‹ (x) The Fat Font Fad - list {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42643 "Go to previous forum topic") [45royale ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42958 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Hofweber

comments.content:
Or [P22 Art Deco Chic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/art-deco-chic/).  
Or [NF Monte Carlo Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/monte-carlo-script-nf/).  
Or [NF Artemisia](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/artemisia-nf/).

I like most of the suggestions that have been given. I was looking for vertical, tall and hooked, and found only a few other fonts that might fit at least parts of that description: [Evita](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/evita/); [ITC Cinderella](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_cinderella/); and [ITC Ironwork](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_ironwork/).

- Mike Yanega

The script version/take would be Expletive by Jonathan Barnbrook

[http://www.virusfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312190657/http:/www.virusfonts.com/ "http://www.virusfonts.com/")
Thanks for all the suggestions guys. I think estilo script is incredibly similar to this, but still not getting what I’m going for at all. I suppose it’s time to make this typeface.
